movies.name: Game of Thrones
movies.summary: Based on the bestselling book series A Song of Ice and Fire by George R.R. Martin, this sprawling new HBO drama is set in a world where summers span decades and winters can last a lifetime. From the scheming south and the savage eastern lands, to the frozen north and ancient Wall that protects the realm from the mysterious darkness beyond, the powerful families of the Seven Kingdoms are locked in a battle for the Iron Throne. This is a story of duplicity and treachery, nobility and honor, conquest and triumph. In the Game of Thrones, you either win or you die.

episodes.name: Winter is Coming
episodes.summary: Lord Eddard Stark, ruler of the North, is summoned to court by his old friend, King Robert Baratheon, to serve as the King's Hand. Eddard reluctantly agrees after learning of a possible threat to the King's life. Eddard's bastard son Jon Snow must make a painful decision about his own future, while in the distant east Viserys Targaryen plots to reclaim his father's throne, usurped by Robert, by selling his sister in marriage.

episodes.name: The Kingsroad
episodes.summary: An incident on the Kingsroad threatens Eddard and Robert's friendship. Jon and Tyrion travel to the Wall, where they discover that the reality of the Night's Watch may not match the heroic image of it.

episodes.name: Lord Snow
episodes.summary: Jon Snow attempts to find his place amongst the Night's Watch. Eddard and his daughters arrive at King's Landing.

episodes.name: Cripples, Bastards, and Broken Things
episodes.summary: Tyrion stops at Winterfell on his way home and gets a frosty reception from Robb Stark. Eddard's investigation into the death of his predecessor gets underway.

episodes.name: The Wolf and the Lion
episodes.summary: Catelyn's actions on the road have repercussions for Eddard. Tyrion enjoys the dubious hospitality of the Eyrie.

episodes.name: A Golden Crown
episodes.summary: Viserys is increasingly frustrated by the lack of progress towards gaining his crown.

episodes.name: You Win or You Die
episodes.summary: Eddard's investigations in King's Landing reach a climax and a dark secret is revealed.

episodes.name: The Pointy End
episodes.summary: Tyrion joins his father's army with unexpected allies. Events in King's Landing take a turn for the worse as Arya's lessons are put to the test.

episodes.name: Baelor
episodes.summary: Catelyn must negotiate with the irascible Lord Walder Frey.

episodes.name: Fire and Blood
episodes.summary: Daenerys must realize her destiny. Jaime finds himself in an unfamiliar predicament.

episodes.name: The North Remembers
episodes.summary: War grips the continent of Westeros. As Tyrion Lannister tries to take his strong-willed nephew in hand in King's Landing, Stannis Baratheon launches his own campaign to take the Iron Throne with the help of a mysterious priestess. In the east, Daenerys must lead her retinue through a desolate wasteland whilst beyond the Wall the Night's Watch seeks the aid of a wildling.

episodes.name: The Night Lands
episodes.summary: Stannis uses Ser Davos to seek out new allies for his war with the Lannisters. On the road north, Arya confides in Gendry. Robb Stark sends Theon Greyjoy to win an alliance with his father and the fierce warriors of the Iron Islands. Cersei and Tyrion clash on how to rule in King's Landing.

episodes.name: What is Dead May Never Die
episodes.summary: Catelyn Stark treats with King Renly in the hope of winning an alliance. Tyrion undertakes a complex plan in King's Landing to expose an enemy. At Winterfell, Bran's dreams continue to trouble him.

episodes.name: Garden of Bones
episodes.summary: Tyrion attempts to restrain Joffrey's cruelty. Catelyn attempts to broker a peace between Stannis and Renly. Daenerys and her followers arrive at the great city of Qarth and hope to find refuge there. Arya and Gendry arrive at Harrenhal, a great castle now under Lannister occupation.

episodes.name: The Ghost of Harrenhal
episodes.summary: Confusion rages in the Stormlands in the wake of a devastating reversal. Catelyn must flee with a new ally, whilst Littlefinger sees an opportunity in the chaos. Theon seeks to prove himself to his father in battle. Arya receives a promise from the enigmatic Jaqen H'ghar. The Night's Watch arrives at the Fist of the First Men. Daenerys Targaryen receives a marriage proposal.

episodes.name: The Old Gods and the New
episodes.summary: Arya has a surprise visitor; Dany vows to take what is hers; Joffrey meets his subjects; Qhorin gives Jon a chance to prove himself.

episodes.name: A Man Without Honor
episodes.summary: Jaime meets a relative; Theon hunts; Dany receives an invitation.

episodes.name: The Prince of Winterfell
episodes.summary: Theon holds the fort; Arya calls in her debt with Jaqen; Robb is betrayed; Stannis and Davos approach their destination.

episodes.name: Blackwater
episodes.summary: A massive battle rages for control of King's Landing and the Iron Throne.

episodes.name: Valar Morghulis
episodes.summary: Tyrion awakens to a changed situation. King Joffrey doles out rewards to his subjects. As Theon stirs his men to action, Luwin offers some final advice. Brienne silences Jaime; Arya receives a gift from Jaqen; Dany goes to a strange place; Jon proves himself to Qhorin.

episodes.name: Valar Dohaeris
episodes.summary: Jon is brought before Mance Rayder, the King Beyond the Wall, while the Night's Watch survivors retreat south. In King's Landing, Tyrion asks for his reward. Littlefinger offers Sansa a way out. Cersei hosts a dinner for the royal family. Daenerys sails into Slaver's Bay.

episodes.name: Dark Wings, Dark Words
episodes.summary: Sansa (Sophie Turner) says too much. Shae (Sibel Kekilli) asks Tyrion (Peter Dinklage) for a favor. Jaime (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) finds a way to pass the time. Arya (Maisie Williams) runs into the Brotherhood Without Banners.

episodes.name: Walk of Punishment
episodes.summary: Tyrion shoulders new responsibilities. Jon (Kit Harington) is taken to the Fist of the First Men. Daenerys (Emilia Clarke) meets with the slavers. Jaime strikes a deal with his captors.

episodes.name: And Now His Watch is Ended
episodes.summary: The Night's Watch takes stock. Varys (Conleth Hill) meets his better. Arya is taken to the commander of the Brotherhood. Daenerys exchanges a chain for a Whip.

episodes.name: Kissed by Fire
episodes.summary: The Hound (Rory McCann) is judged by the gods; Jaime is judged by men. Jon proves himself; Robb (Richard Madden) is betrayed. Tyrion learns the cost of weddings.

episodes.name: The Climb
episodes.summary: Tywin (Charles Dance) plans strategic unions for the Lannisters. Melisandre (Carice van Houten) visits the Riverlands. Robb (Richard Madden) weighs a compromise to repair his alliance with House Frey. Roose Bolton (Michael McElhatton) decides what to do with Jaime Lannister (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau). Jon (Kit Harington), Ygritte (Rose Leslie) and the Wildlings face a daunting climb.

episodes.name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair
episodes.summary: Daenerys (Emilia Clarke) exchanges gifts with a slave lord outside Yunkai. As Sansa (Sophie Turner) frets about her prospects, Shae (Sibel Kekilli) chafes at Tyrion's (Peter Dinklage) new situation. Tywin counsels the king, and Melisandre reveals a secret to Gendry (Joe Dempsie). Brienne (Gwendoline Christie) faces a formidable foe in Harrenhal.

episodes.name: Second Sons
episodes.summary: King's Landing hosts a wedding, and Tyrion and Sansa spend the night together. Daenerys meets the Titan's Bastard. Davos (Liam Cunningham) demands proof from Melisandre. Sam (John Bradley) and Gilly (Hannah Murray) meet an older Gentleman.

episodes.name: The Rains of Castamere
episodes.summary: Robb (Richard Madden) presents himself to Walder Frey (David Bradley), and Edmure (Tobias Menzies) meets his bride. Jon (Kit Harington) faces his harshest test yet. Bran (Isaac Hempstead Wright) discovers a new gift. Daario (Ed Skrein) and Jorah (Iain Glen) debate how to take Yunkai. House Frey joins with House Tully.

episodes.name: Mhysa
episodes.summary: Joffrey (Jack Gleeson) challenges Tywin (Charles Dance). Bran tells a ghost story. In Dragonstone, mercy comes from strange quarters. Daenerys (Emilia Clarke) waits to see if she is a conqueror or a liberator.

episodes.name: Two Swords
episodes.summary: Tyrion (Peter Dinklage) welcomes a guest to King's Landing. At Castle Black, Jon Snow (Kit Harington) finds himself unwelcome. Dany (Emilia Clarke) is pointed to Meereen, the mother of all slave cities. Arya (Maisie Williams) runs into an old friend.

episodes.name: The Lion and the Rose
episodes.summary: Tyrion lends Jaime (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) a hand. Joffrey (Jack Gleeson) and Margaery (Natalie Dormer) host a breakfast. At Dragonstone, Stannis (Stephen Dillane) loses patience with Davos (Liam Cunningham). Ramsay (Iwan Rheon) finds a purpose for his pet. North of the Wall, Bran (Isaac Hempstead Wright) sees where they must go.

episodes.name: Breaker of Chains
episodes.summary: Tyrion ponders his options. Tywin (Charles Dance) extends an olive branch. Sam (John Bradley) realizes Castle Black isn't safe, and Jon proposes a bold plan. The Hound (Rory McCann) teaches Arya the way things are. Dany chooses her Champion.

episodes.name: Oathkeeper
episodes.summary: Dany balances justice and mercy. Jaime tasks Brienne (Gwendoline Christie) with his honor. Jon secures volunteers while Bran, Jojen (Thomas Brodie-Sangster), Meera (Ellie Kendrick) and Hodor (Kristian Nairn) stumble on shelter.

episodes.name: First of His Name
episodes.summary: Cersei (Lena Headey) and Tywin (Charles Dance) plot the Crown's next move. Dany (Emilia Clarke) discusses future plans. Jon (Kit Harington) embarks on a new mission.

episodes.name: The Laws of Gods and Men
episodes.summary: Stannis (Stephen Dillane) and Davos (Liam Cunningham) set sail with a new strategy. Dany meets with supplicants. Tyrion (Peter Dinklage) faces down his father in the throne room.

episodes.name: Mockingbird
episodes.summary: Tyrion enlists an unlikely ally. Daario (Michiel Huisman) entreats Dany to allow him to do what he does best. Jon's warnings about the Wall's vulnerability fall on deaf ears. Brienne (Gwendoline Christie) follows a new lead on the road with Pod (Daniel Portman).

episodes.name: The Mountain and the Viper
episodes.summary: Mole's Town receives unexpected visitors. Littlefinger's (Aidan Gillen) motives are questioned. Ramsay (Iwan Rhoen) attempts to prove himself to his father. Tyrion's (Peter Dinklage) fate is decided.

episodes.name: The Watchers on the Wall
episodes.summary: Jon Snow (Kit Harington) and the rest of the Night's Watch face the biggest challenge to the Wall yet.

episodes.name: The Children
episodes.summary: An unexpected arrival north of the Wall changes circumstances. Dany (Emilia Clarke) is forced to face harsh realities. Bran (Isaac Hempstead Wright) learns more of his destiny. Tyrion sees the truth of his Situation.

episodes.name: The Wars to Come
episodes.summary: In the Season 5 premiere, Varys discusses a conspiracy with Tyrion; Daenerys' rule faces a new threat; Jon finds himself between two kings; and Cersei and Jaime try to move on from Tywin's demise.

episodes.name: The House of Black and White
episodes.summary: Arya arrives in Braavos; Brienne and Podrick find danger while traveling; Cersei worries about Myrcella in Dorne when Ellaria Sand seeks revenge for Oberyn's death; Jon is tempted by Stannis.

episodes.name: High Sparrow
episodes.summary: Cersei meets the High Sparrow after learning of a clergyman's embarrassing tale. Meanwhile, Davos talks to Jon about the future of Winterfell, where Ramsay Snow has just learned the identity of his future bride; Arya grows impatient doing menial tasks in the House of Black and White; and Tyrion searches for more comfortable surroundings on a long trip with Varys.

episodes.name: Sons of the Harpy
episodes.summary: Margaery seeks prudent counsel. Jaime Struggles in foreign lands. Dany answers the Harpy's call.

episodes.name: Kill the Boy
episodes.summary: Dany makes a difficult decision in Meereen. Jon recruits the help of an unexpected ally. Brienne searches for Sansa. Theon remains under Ramsay's control.

episodes.name: Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken
episodes.summary: Arya trains. Jorah and Tyrion run into slavers. Trystane and Myrcella make plans. Jaime and Bronn reach their destination. The Sand Snakes attack.

episodes.name: The Gift
episodes.summary: Jon prepares for conflict. Sansa tries to talk to Theon. Brienne waits for a sign. Stannis remains stubborn. Jaime attempts to reconnect with family.

episodes.name: Hardhome
episodes.summary: Arya makes progress in her training. Sansa confronts an old friend. Cersei struggles. Jon travels.

episodes.name: The Dance of Dragons
episodes.summary: Stannis confronts a troubling decision. Jon returns to The Wall. Mace visits the Iron Bank. Arya encounters someone from her past. Dany reluctantly oversees a traditional celebration of athleticism.

episodes.name: Mother's Mercy
episodes.summary: Cersei seeks forgiveness; Jon faces a new challenge; Arya plots to cross a name off her list; Tyrion sees a familiar face; and Daenerys finds herself surrounded by strangers.

episodes.name: The Red Woman
episodes.summary: Jon Snow is dead. Daenerys meets a strong man. Cersei sees her daughter again.

episodes.name: Home
episodes.summary: Bran trains with the Three-Eyed Raven. In King's Landing, Jaime advises Tommen. Tyrion demands good news, but has to make his own. At Castle Black, the Night's Watch stands behind Thorne. Ramsay Bolton proposes a plan, and Balon Greyjoy entertains other proposals.

episodes.name: Oathbreaker
episodes.summary: Daenerys meets her future. Bran meets the past. Tommen confronts the High Sparrow. Arya trains to be No One. Varys finds an answer. Ramsay gets a gift.

episodes.name: Book of the Stranger
episodes.summary: Tyrion strikes a deal. Jorah and Daario undertake a difficult task. Jaime and Cersei try to improve their situation.

episodes.name: The Door
episodes.summary: Tyrion seeks a strange ally. Bran learns a great deal. Brienne goes on a mission. Arya is given a chance to prove herself.

episodes.name: Blood of My Blood
episodes.summary: An old foe comes back into the picture. Gilly meets Sam's family. Arya faces a difficult choice. Jaime faces off against the High Sparrow.

episodes.name: The Broken Man
episodes.summary: The High Sparrow eyes another target. Jaime confronts a hero. Arya makes a plan. The North is reminded.

episodes.name: No One
episodes.summary:
Jaime encounters a hero; the High Sparrow fixates on another prey; Arya hatches a new plan; Yara and Theon plot their next move; Olenna and Cersei discuss their families' futures.

While Jaime weighs his options, Cersei answers a request. Tyrion's plans bear fruit. Arya faces a new test.

episodes.name: Battle of the Bastards
episodes.summary: Ramsay surprises his audience. Jon retaliates. Dany is true to her word.

episodes.name: The Winds of Winter
episodes.summary: Alliances are made, the High Sparrow is holding trials at King's Landing, Daenerys is sailing for the Seven Kingdoms and a new King of the North is crowned.

episodes.name: Dragonstone
episodes.summary: Jon organizes the defense of the North. Cersei tries to even the odds. Daenerys comes home.

episodes.name: Stormborn
episodes.summary: Daenerys receives an unexpected visitor. Jon faces a revolt. Tyrion plans the conquest of Westeros.

episodes.name: The Queen's Justice
episodes.summary: Daenerys holds court. Cersei returns a gift. Jaime learns from his mistakes.

episodes.name: The Spoils of War
episodes.summary: Arya gets to the final destination. Daenerys takes it upon herself to strike back.

episodes.name: Eastwatch
episodes.summary: Daenerys demands loyalty from the surviving Lannister soldiers; Jon heeds Bran's warning about White Walkers on the move; Cersei vows to vanquish anyone or anything that stands in her way.

episodes.name: Beyond the Wall
episodes.summary: Jon's mission continues north of the wall, but the odds against his ragged band of misfits may be greater than he imagined.

episodes.name: The Dragon and the Wolf
episodes.summary: Cersei sits on the Iron Throne; Daenerys sails across the Narrow Sea; Jon Snow is King in the North, and winter is finally here.

movies.name: Mr. Robot
movies.summary: Mr. Robot follows Elliot, a young programmer who works as a cyber-security engineer by day and as a vigilante hacker by night. Elliot finds himself at a crossroads when the mysterious leader of an underground hacker group recruits him to destroy the firm he is paid to protect. Compelled by his personal beliefs, Elliot struggles to resist the chance to take down the multinational CEOs he believes are running (and ruining) the world.

episodes.name: eps1.0_hellofriend.mov
episodes.summary: In MR. ROBOT, Elliot, a cyber-security engineer by day and vigilante hacker by night, is recruited by a mysterious underground group to destroy the firm he's paid to protect. Elliot must decide how far he'll go to expose the forces he believes are running (and ruining) the world.

episodes.name: eps1.1_ones-and-zer0es.mpeg
episodes.summary: Tyrell Wellick, now Evil Corp's acting CTO since Elliot helped get Terry Colby arrested, makes Elliot an offer he can (and does) refuse: a position as Evil Corp's head of Cyber Security and a big bank account to match. By saying no, has Elliot made himself a mark for Wellick?

episodes.name: eps1.2_d3bug.mkv
episodes.summary: After being shoved off the railing in Coney Island by Mr. Robot, Elliot wakes up in a hospital room, badly banged up. Krista, his psychiatrist, is inclined to send him to rehab unless he's willing to be regularly drug tested. Elliot complies, knowing that he can easily change the hospital records for the tests since he hacked their system long ago.

episodes.name: eps1.3_da3m0ns.mp4
episodes.summary: At fsociety, Elliot lays out his plan to hack Steel Mountain's climate control system and raise the heat high enough to melt all the tapes that record the data. Romero points out the plan's many flaws but when Elliot remembers that they only have a few days left before Evil Corp switches over to their new redundant security protocols based on what Tyrell Wellick told him, they reluctantly agree it's now or never.

episodes.name: eps1.4_3xpl0its.wmv
episodes.summary: Fsociety attempts to penetrate Steel Mountain, the most secure data facility in America.

movies.name: House of Cards
movies.summary: Based on the BBC miniseries of the same name, House of Cards follows Francis Underwood, the politician's politician – masterful, beguiling, charismatic and ruthless. He and his equally ambitious wife Claire will stop at nothing to ensure their ascendancy. This wicked political drama slithers beneath the curtain and through the back halls of greed, sex, love and corruption in modern Washington D.C.

episodes.name: Chapter 1
episodes.summary: Allegiances are abandoned after a promise is broken in the opener of this drama, which follows a ruthless congressman and his equally ambitious wife as they navigate the corridors of power in Washington, D.C.

episodes.name: Chapter 2
episodes.summary: Francis attacks the White House through the media; Claire makes a cruel decision.

episodes.name: Chapter 3
episodes.summary: Francis deals with a crisis in his home district; Zoe experiences the politics of journalism.

episodes.name: Chapter 4
episodes.summary: Francis takes on leaders in Congress; Peter Russo is forced to choose between politics and family.

episodes.name: Chapter 5
episodes.summary: Francis' fight over an education bill creates unfortunate side effects.

episodes.name: Chapter 6
episodes.summary: Francis battles striking teachers; Claire receives a surprise confession.

episodes.name: Chapter 7
episodes.summary: Francis wins a major victory; Peter faces his past; and Stamper attempts to bury a secret.

episodes.name: Chapter 8
episodes.summary: Francis receives an honor; Peter returns to Philadelphia.

episodes.name: Chapter 9
episodes.summary: Francis and Stamper seek support in Congress.

episodes.name: Chapter 10
episodes.summary: Claire defies Francis; Peter presents an ultimatum.

episodes.name: Chapter 11
episodes.summary: Peter battles personal demons; Francis enters dangerous territory.

episodes.name: Chapter 12
episodes.summary: Francis takes an unexpected detour.

episodes.name: Chapter 13
episodes.summary: Francis desperately tries to keep his plan on track in the Season 1 finale. Later, Claire suffers the consequences of her decisions.

episodes.name: Chapter 14
episodes.summary: The Underwoods face two threats in the Season 2 premiere. Later, Francis grooms his replacement; and Claire goes on the offensive.

episodes.name: Chapter 15
episodes.summary: Francis targets China. Meanwhile, Claire confronts a painful trauma from her past; and Lucas Goodwin presses for the truth.

episodes.name: Chapter 16
episodes.summary: Tensions rise between Francis and Raymond Tusk. Later, a battle in the Senate pits Francis against the Republicans.

episodes.name: Chapter 17
episodes.summary: A terror scare at the Capitol traps Francis with a resentful Donald Blythe. Meanwhile, Claire gives an attention-grabbing live interview.

episodes.name: Chapter 18
episodes.summary: Lucas goes to extreme measures to expose Francis.

episodes.name: Chapter 19
episodes.summary: Francis and Tusk end their alliance. Meanwhile, Lucas must make a difficult choice; and Stamper grows closer to Rachel.

episodes.name: Chapter 20
episodes.summary: The Walkers deepen their friendship with the Underwoods.

episodes.name: Chapter 21
episodes.summary: Claire influences Tricia Walker politically and domestically. Later, Francis has a showdown with Linda Vasquez.

episodes.name: Chapter 22
episodes.summary: Tusk blindsides the Underwoods.

episodes.name: Chapter 23
episodes.summary: Francis tries to finish off Tusk for good. Later, Claire and Jackie Sharp collide.

episodes.name: Chapter 24
episodes.summary: Francis is interrogated. Meanwhile, Stamper wrestles with personal demons.

episodes.name: Chapter 25
episodes.summary: Francis finds himself shut out. Later, Claire makes a difficult sacrifice; and Stamper tries to regain control.

episodes.name: Chapter 26
episodes.summary: Francis faces annihilation in the Season 2 finale. Meanwhile, Stamper ties up loose ends; and Claire feels the repercussions of ruthlessness.

episodes.name: Chapter 27
episodes.summary: A rocky start for the Underwood Presidency. Frank wants to introduce an ambitious jobs program, while Claire sets her sights on the United Nations.

episodes.name: Chapter 28
episodes.summary: Claire's U.N. bid runs into trouble. Frank fights off mutiny with a bold address to the country.

episodes.name: Chapter 29
episodes.summary: The Russian President's state visit becomes a Cold War of wills and some punks heat things up.

episodes.name: Chapter 30
episodes.summary: Claire bypasses Russia at the U.N. Frank tries to outmaneuver a potential challenger and ends up face to face with a higher power.

episodes.name: Chapter 31
episodes.summary: Frank declares war on Congress to jump-start his jobs program. Claire spars with the Russian ambassador.

episodes.name: Chapter 32
episodes.summary: Frank and Claire travel to Moscow to negotiate the return of an imprisoned U.S. citizen. Claire takes a stand that jeopardizes their plans.

episodes.name: Chapter 33
episodes.summary: The damage is done, and the Underwoods must repair it. But deep wounds don't heal fast and sometimes not at all.

episodes.name: Chapter 34
episodes.summary: A hurricane endangers more than just the entire East Coast, and Frank must make a difficult choice.

episodes.name: Chapter 35
episodes.summary: The Jordan Valley erupts in chaos just as Frank's campaign is picking up steam. Claire gets disturbing intel and counsels him.

episodes.name: Chapter 36
episodes.summary: Frank needs to deal with Petrov one on one, while Claire tries to preserve the peacekeeping mission. Sacrifices must be made.

episodes.name: Chapter 37
episodes.summary: Things turn ugly when Frank, Jackie, and Heather square off during their first debate. Tom joins Claire on the campaign trail.

episodes.name: Chapter 38
episodes.summary: The Jordan Valley erupts in chaos just as Frank's campaign is picking up steam. Claire gets disturbing intel and counsels him.

episodes.name: Chapter 39
episodes.summary: In the midst of the Iowa caucuses, Frank and Claire must confront hard truths about each other.

episodes.name: Chapter 40
episodes.summary: Claire's absence causes problems for Frank on the campaign trail amid rumors of a marital rift. Claire tries to strike out on her own.

episodes.name: Chapter 41
episodes.summary: As Claire begins exploring a campaign of her own, she and Frank engage in backdoor political maneuvering. But this time they're not on the same side.

episodes.name: Chapter 42
episodes.summary: Claire joins Frank as he stumps in South Carolina, but he doesn't trust her. A disastrous scandal blindsides Frank's campaign on primary day.

episodes.name: Chapter 43
episodes.summary: Claire threatens Frank. Frank makes a politically bold move that may provoke Russia. An event at a campaign stop changes everything.

episodes.name: Chapter 44
episodes.summary: Claire advises Donald Blythe on dealing with Petrov. Further investigations of Lucas Goodwin dredges up his accusations against Frank.

episodes.name: Chapter 45
episodes.summary: Claire clashes with the Secretary of State over her involvement in negotiations with Russia. Dunbar must choose between her campaign and her ethics.

episodes.name: Chapter 46
episodes.summary: Frank and Claire adjust to their new reality. The search for Frank's running mate begins. Frank starts a campaign to weaken Conway's strong support.

episodes.name: Chapter 47
episodes.summary: Formidable as ever, both Underwoods have their eyes on the big picture as they manipulate a potential running mate and push the gun bill.

episodes.name: Chapter 48
episodes.summary: At the convention, Frank and his team publicly push for Catherine Durant to be chosen as his running mate, but privately pursue a different agenda.

episodes.name: Chapter 49
episodes.summary: As Frank deals with a new threat to his candidacy, Claire has doubts about their plan. Claire faces a difficult decision concerning her mother.

episodes.name: Chapter 50
episodes.summary: Frank ups the ante on the war on terror to counter Conway's public show of strength. Tom joins Claire on the campaign trail.

episodes.name: Chapter 51
episodes.summary: Frank asks Will to help deal with extremists threatening to murder hostages. Hammerschmidt digs deeper into the allegations against Frank.

episodes.name: Chapter 52
episodes.summary: As the hostage situation continues, Claire secretly negotiates with Yusuf al Ahmadi. Frank confronts Hammerschmidt.

episodes.name: Chapter 53
episodes.summary: As Congress debates investigating Frank, he and Claire attempt to stoke fear of terrorism. Tom Yates continues his stay in the White House.

episodes.name: Chapter 54
episodes.summary: Frank and his team work to leverage support in key states by any means necessary. Claire learns some upsetting news about one of Frank's friends.

episodes.name: Chapter 55
episodes.summary: The day before the election, Conway holds a 24-hour Skype session with voters, while Frank and Claire stump in key states and try to discredit him.

episodes.name: Chapter 56
episodes.summary: With a tight race and low voter turnout on Election Day, things look grim for Frank. But he's still got one more trick up his sleeve.

episodes.name: Chapter 57
episodes.summary: Nine weeks after Election Day, the Underwoods work to consolidate their power. Leann tries to track down a missing Aidan Macallan.

episodes.name: Chapter 58
episodes.summary: In the midst of uncertainty, suspected Russian forces take over an American station in Antarctica. Meanwhile, a damaging news leak could hurt Frank.

episodes.name: Chapter 59
episodes.summary: When a crisis forces White House personnel to take shelter in a bunker, Commerce Department official Jane Davis negotiates through back channels.

episodes.name: Chapter 60
episodes.summary: While Frank attends an elite men's weekend gathering to firm up support, Claire deals with a stranded Russian ship and threats from Petrov.

episodes.name: Chapter 61
episodes.summary: Petrov tries to influence affairs in the U.S. Jane discusses her agenda with Claire. With her job at stake, Leann reaches out to a reporter for help.

episodes.name: Chapter 62
episodes.summary: The Underwoods and their team angle to undermine the revived committee investigating Frank. Hammerschmidt's investigation heats up.

episodes.name: Chapter 63
episodes.summary: As the team tries to control fallout from damaging testimony and leaks, everyone is under suspicion and tensions flare between Frank and Claire.

episodes.name: Chapter 64
episodes.summary: Frank attempts to stop Cathy from testifying. With Hammerschmidt sniffing out the truth, the Underwoods throw someone close to them under the bus.

episodes.name: Chapter 65
episodes.summary: In the wake of a surprising announcement, everything at the White House is shaken up. A decision must be made about whether to go to war.

movies.name: Better Call Saul
movies.summary: Better Call Saul is the prequel to the award-winning series Breaking Bad, set six years before Saul Goodman became Walter White's lawyer. When we meet him, the man who will become Saul Goodman is known as Jimmy McGill, a small-time lawyer searching for his destiny, and, more immediately, hustling to make ends meet. Working alongside, and often against, Jimmy is "fixer" Mike Ehrmantraut, a beloved character introduced in Breaking Bad. The series will track Jimmy's transformation into Saul Goodman, the man who puts "criminal" in "criminal lawyer.

episodes.name: Uno
episodes.summary: Jimmy works his magic in the courtroom. Unexpected inspiration leads him to an unconventional pursuit of potential clients.

episodes.name: Mijo
episodes.summary: As his troubles escalate to a boiling point, Jimmy finds himself in dire straits. An act of carelessness puts Chuck at risk.

episodes.name: Nacho
episodes.summary: Jimmy pulls out all the stops to prove that a dangerous client is innocent, even though it causes some friction with Kim.

episodes.name: Hero
episodes.summary: Jimmy conjures up a bold plan to solicit new clients, but has to face the consequences when the scheme strains his relationship with a rival firm.

episodes.name: Alpine Shepherd Boy
episodes.summary: When his efforts to drum up new business are interrupted by alarming news, Jimmy is pressured to make a difficult choice.

episodes.name: Five-O
episodes.summary: Mike's tragic past comes back to haunt him, and he's forced to seek help from an unusual source. Meanwhile, Jimmy's moral compass is put to the test.

episodes.name: Bingo
episodes.summary: Jimmy meets with potential new clients. Then, when given the opportunity to do the right thing, he cashes in a favor from an unlikely ally.

episodes.name: Rico
episodes.summary: Jimmy shows Chuck that he's willing to do almost anything to win a case, even if it means getting his hands dirty.

episodes.name: Pimento
episodes.summary: Chuck urges Jimmy to accept a harsh truth. Meanwhile, a deal threatens to go off the rails when Mike's ability to complete a job is called into question.

episodes.name: Marco
episodes.summary: In the aftermath of recent events, Jimmy seizes the opportunity to reconnect with an old friend. Meanwhile, Chuck adjusts to a new way of life.

episodes.name: Switch
episodes.summary: Jimmy and Kim's relationship takes a new turn. Mike decides it's for the best to sever his affiliation with an unrestrained associate.

episodes.name: Cobbler
episodes.summary: Mike brokers a deal in order to keep a potentially messy situation intact; Jimmy tries to exonerate an eccentric client.

episodes.name: Amarillo
episodes.summary: Jimmy's client outreach efforts succeed, and he exhibits new heights of showmanship; Mike is puzzled by Stacey's upsetting news.

episodes.name: Gloves Off
episodes.summary: Jimmy's actions unexpectedly create waves for Kim. Meanwhile, Mike cautiously weighs a lucrative proposal that might bring about dire consequences.

episodes.name: Rebecca
episodes.summary: Jimmy becomes frustrated with his restrictive work environment. Meanwhile, Kim pulls out all the stops to dig herself out of a seemingly bottomless hole at HHM.

episodes.name: Bali Ha'i
episodes.summary: Jimmy finds comfort in familiarity; Kim receives a life-changing proposal; when he is threatened, Mike finds himself pushed to the limit.

episodes.name: Inflatable
episodes.summary: Mike's growing frustration shows when his hand is forced, but with Jimmy's help, he works to keep the peace. Meanwhile, Jimmy boldly forges a new path forward.

episodes.name: Fifi
episodes.summary: Mike is determined to settle the score with a dangerous adversary. An unexpected opportunity to gain a competitive edge falls in Jimmy's lap.

episodes.name: Nailed
episodes.summary: Mike takes a methodical approach to his mission. Someone questions Chuck's capabilities. Jimmy faces a personal dilemma.

episodes.name: Klick
episodes.summary: Jimmy is forced to make a hard choice. Mike takes matters into his own hands. Hamlin relays shocking news while Chuck's condition continues to evolve.

episodes.name: Mabel
episodes.summary: Jimmy and Chuck's relationship deteriorates; Kim feels the pressure of running her own firm; Mike investigates the note left on his car.

episodes.name: Witness
episodes.summary: Jimmy and Kim hire an assistant; Mike seeks out a mysterious acquaintance; Chuck uses the law to gain an advantage over Jimmy.

episodes.name: Sunk Costs
episodes.summary: Jimmy decides to represent a new client to Kim's dismay; Mike meets a formidable ally who gives a tempting offer.

episodes.name: Sabrosito
episodes.summary: Jimmy asks a favor of Mike; new complications disrupt Salamancas' business; Chuck and Jimmy struggle with a compromise.

episodes.name: Chicanery
episodes.summary: Kim and Jimmy face off with an adversary; Jimmy looks to Chuck's past to secure his future; Jimmy loses an ally and gains another.

episodes.name: Off Brand
episodes.summary: Jimmy has a new endeavor; Chuck pushes himself to the limit; Nacho finds himself in a power struggle.

episodes.name: Expenses
episodes.summary: Jimmy tries to settle debts; Nacho reunites with an acquaintance; Mike helps Stacey with a project and makes a connection.

episodes.name: Slip
episodes.summary: Jimmy is pushed to desperate measures; Nacho picks up a skill; Mike explores an alliance; Kim stands up to Hamlin.

episodes.name: Fall
episodes.summary: Jimmy visits a friend and takes up an old pastime; Chuck and Hamlin argue over the future of the firm; Kim faces challenges.

episodes.name: Lantern
episodes.summary: Kim takes time off; Jimmy tries to make amends; Nacho gambles with his future; Hamlin pushes Chuck to make a decision.

episodes.name: Smoke
episodes.summary: Jimmy struggles to cope with Chuck's tragic death; Mike ponders his role at Madrigal; Howard makes a startling confession.

episodes.name: Breathe
episodes.summary: Jimmy seeks new employment; Gus navigates the fallout from Hector's collapse; Kim endeavors to support Jimmy in the wake of Chuck's death.

episodes.name: Something Beautiful
episodes.summary: Jimmy puts a risky plan into motion; as alliances shift, Nacho finds himself in the crosshairs; Kim contemplates her future.

episodes.name: Talk
episodes.summary: A restless Jimmy embarks on a new endeavor while Mike burns bridges; Kim pursues her bliss; Nacho tries to survive a turf war.

episodes.name: Quite a Ride
episodes.summary: Jimmy identifies a new market for his talents; Mike vets a potential partnership; Kim drives a hard bargain.

episodes.name: Piñata
episodes.summary: While Jimmy dreams of Wexler-McGill, Kim makes a bold move; Mike puts a plan into motion for Gus.

episodes.name: Something Stupid
episodes.summary: Jimmy expands his business, but runs into a problem that only Kim can solve; Gus intervenes in Hector's medical care; Mike deals with a setback.

episodes.name: Coushatta
episodes.summary: Jimmy goes to great lengths to right a wrong, as Kim pulls out all the stops for a case; Mike lets his team blow off steam; Nacho receives a visitor.

episodes.name: Wiedersehen
episodes.summary: Jimmy and Kim unburden themselves, risking their relationship in the process; Nacho is forced to make the rounds with Lalo; Mike has cause to worry.

episodes.name: Winner
episodes.summary: Jimmy turns the page on his reputation; Lalo tracks a loose end in Gus' operation; Mike is forced to make a difficult decision.

movies.name: Narcos
movies.summary: Narcos chronicle the life and death of drug lord Pablo Escobar the ruthless boss of the Medellin Cartel and a known terrorist who was also a congressman, a family man and revered by the poor as a new Robin Hood.

episodes.name: Descenso
episodes.summary: A Chilean drugsproducer, the chemist Cockroach, brings his product to the Colombian smuggler Pablo Escobar. DEA-Agent Steve Murphy is fighting drugs in Bogota.

episodes.name: The Sword of Simón Bolívar
episodes.summary: The communistic radical group M-19 are counteracting the drug lords and Murphy's new partner Peña teaches him the Colombian way of law enforcement.

episodes.name: The Men of Always
episodes.summary: Murphy is confronted with corruption in the Colombian government once he tries to discolate Escobar's his political ambition together with his partner Peña.

episodes.name: The Palace in Flames
episodes.summary: Despite a new extradition treaty, the USA is increasing their budget to fight communism. It will create new challenges for Murphy and Peña to hunt for Pablo Escobar.

episodes.name: There Will Be a Future
episodes.summary: Pablo's extreme methods is almost leading to a war between drug lords, Carillo and the government. Peña tries to protect his witness Elisa.

episodes.name: Explosivos
episodes.summary: Gacha was almost caught by Peña and Carillo. Murphy tries to protect candidate Gaviria against assassins with ties to Pablo as she is in favour for extradition.

episodes.name: You Will Cry Tears of Blood
episodes.summary: Pablo went to hiding as political tides are turning against him, but he finds a way to beat back. The CIA is finally offering their help to Peña and Murphy.

episodes.name: La Gran Mentira
episodes.summary: A tragic mistake forces the government to change strategies to fight Pablo, but Pablo has bigger issues as there is danger from within his empire.

episodes.name: La Catedral
episodes.summary: The hunt for Pablo seems to be over once he signs a deal with the government, but Murphy, Peña and the Calicartel have different thoughts about that.

episodes.name: Despegue
episodes.summary: Pablo's activities in prison forces the government to use extreme actions. Murphy and Peña have to deal with a problematic situation.

episodes.name: Free at Last
episodes.summary: In the aftermath of a massive military effort to take Pablo into custody, the family reunites while enemies worry. Steve and Connie fight about safety.

episodes.name: Cambalache
episodes.summary: Tata gets impatient with life on the run. Pablo responds to President Gaviria's reward offer. Steve and Javier meet their new boss.

episodes.name: Our Man in Madrid
episodes.summary: President Gaviria has a new job for an old colleague. The Search Bloc's new tactics shake up Pablo, but also unsettle Steve and Javier.

episodes.name: The Good, the Bad, and the Dead
episodes.summary: The Cali cartel discusses moving in on Pablo's territory. Limon proposes a plan to Maritza. Tata gets a gun for protection.

episodes.name: The Enemies of My Enemy
episodes.summary: The Search Bloc gets a new leader. Javier loses faith in the system. Pablo brings Tata brother Carlos down from Miami to cheer her up.

episodes.name: Los Pepes
episodes.summary: The newly-formed Los Pepes want to destroy Pablo and his empire. Tata's brother urges her to leave and seek safety with her children.

episodes.name: Deutschland 93
episodes.summary: As the danger intensifies for the Escobars, Pablo sends his family to another country. Gaviria weighs the opportunity to use them as leverage.

episodes.name: Exit El Patrón
episodes.summary: Colombia begins to turn on Escobar after his latest terrorist attack. Tata receives help from an unlikely ally. Quica gets increasingly anxious.

episodes.name: Nuestra Finca
episodes.summary: Pablo is reunited with an estranged family member. Judy Moncada's life is put in danger. The DEA and CIA clash over how to handle Los Pepes.

episodes.name: Al Fin Cayó!
episodes.summary: Javier deals with the repercussions from Judy's interview. Tata tries to convince Pablo to surrender for the sake of his children.

episodes.name: The Kingpin Strategy
episodes.summary: The Gentlemen of Cali gather their associates together for a big surprise announcement about the future of their business.

episodes.name: The Cali KGB
episodes.summary: A gas incident threatens to disrupt the Cali-government deal and Jorge is asked to help out. Peña grapples with his former Los Pepes connection.

episodes.name: Follow the Money
episodes.summary: The Rodriguez brothers go into hiding during negotiations. Pacho meets with the Lord of the Skies in Mexico. Peña's new DEA team visits Cali.

episodes.name: Checkmate
episodes.summary: Peña hatches a plan to try to capture Cali leader Gilberto Rodriguez. Amado proposes a business idea to Pacho.

episodes.name: MRO
episodes.summary: Paranoid about leaks, Miguel cracks down on his security. Pacho makes a decision about his new offer. Peña works on cultivating a witness.

episodes.name: Best Laid Plans
episodes.summary: Jorge takes a dangerous risk. An accident in New York threatens to expose Chepe. Peña travels to Curaçao to arrest a potential witness.

episodes.name: Sin Salida
episodes.summary: Peña plans another covert operation to take down a key Cali cartel member, but he risks running out of time during his search.

episodes.name: Convivir
episodes.summary: David seeks revenge on behalf of his father, putting Enrique in danger. Peña asks Don Berna for help on a rescue mission.

episodes.name: Todos Los Hombres del Presidente
episodes.summary: David follows his suspicions. Peña is shocked to discover the depth of corruption in the Colombian government. Miguel is sought after once again.

episodes.name: Going Back to Cali
episodes.summary: David and Peña are in a race against each other to find Pallomari. Peña makes a serious decision about the future of his career.

movies.name: Stranger Things
movies.summary: A love letter to the '80s classics that captivated a generation, Stranger Things is set in 1983 Indiana, where a young boy vanishes into thin air. As friends, family and local police search for answers, they are drawn into an extraordinary mystery involving top-secret government experiments, terrifying supernatural forces and one very strange little girl.

episodes.name: Chapter One: The Vanishing of Will Byers
episodes.summary: A young boy mysteriously disappears, and his panicked mother demands that the police find him. Meanwhile, the boy's friends conduct their own search, and meet a mysterious girl in the forest.

episodes.name: Chapter Two: The Weirdo on Maple Street
episodes.summary: While the search for the missing Will continues, Joyce tells Jim about a call she apparently received from her son. Meanwhile, Jane warns Mike that there are bad people after her, and he realizes that she knows what happened to Will.

episodes.name: Chapter Three: Holly, Jolly
episodes.summary: While Nancy looks for a missing Barbara and realizes that Jonathan may have been the last person to see her, Mike and his friends go out with Jane to find the missing Will. Meanwhile, Jim tracks Will to the lab.

episodes.name: Chapter Four: The Body
episodes.summary: Jim realizes that the government is covering something up about Will's death and begins a personal investigation. Meanwhile, Nancy discovers that Jonathan has information about Barbara's disappearance, while Mike and his friends smuggle Jane into the school so she can use the ham radio to contact Will.

episodes.name: Chapter Five: The Flea and the Acrobat
episodes.summary: Jim searches for Will at Hawkins Laboratory, but finds something unexpected. Meanwhile, Lonnie helps Joyce bury Will but reveals an ulterior motive for returning to town, while the boys find a way to locate Will but discover that Jane is opposing them.

episodes.name: Chapter Six: The Monster
episodes.summary: Jonathan manages to pull Nancy back to the real world from the Upside Down. Meanwhile, Lucas refuses to help with the search for Jane and goes to Hawkins Labs on his own, while Dustin and Mike look for the missing girl.

episodes.name: Chapter Seven: The Bathtub
episodes.summary: Jim manages to bring everyone together so that they can join forces to reconnect Jane to the Upside Down and find Will. Meanwhile, the government closes in on Jane and the boys.

episodes.name: Chapter Eight: The Upside Down
episodes.summary: Jim convinces Brenner to let him and Joyce enter the Upside Down to find Will... unaware that Brenner plans to recover Jane no matter what it takes. Meanwhile, Nancy and Jonathan prepare to trap the monster at the Byers house, but receive an unexpected visitor.

episodes.name: Chapter One: MADMAX
episodes.summary: One year after the events with the Upside Down and the Demogorgon, Will meets with a government doctor. The boys discover that there's a new player in town, and Jim pays a visit to El.

episodes.name: Chapter Two: Trick or Treat, Freak
episodes.summary: The boys go trick-or-treating on Halloween, and Will has another vision. Meanwhile, El relieves the days following her escape from the Upside Down, and Dustin finds something in the garbage can.

episodes.name: Chapter Three: The Pollywog
episodes.summary: Dustin takes in a stray and calls it D'Artagnan. However, his plans to show it to Mr. Clarke don't go as intended. Meanwhile, Max tries to convince Mike to let her join the group, El sneaks out to pay her friends a visit, and Will decides to take a stand and face his fears.

episodes.name: Chapter Four: Will the Wise
episodes.summary: After his encounter with the shadow creature, Will's condition worsens. Meanwhile, Jim and El fight after Jim discovers that El disobeyed the rules, and Owens brings Nancy and Jonathan to Hawkins Labs for a chat.

episodes.name: Chapter Five: Dig Dug
episodes.summary: Jim is trapped in the Upside Down, and Joyce enlists Bob to help find him. Meanwhile, Nancy and Jonathan go to Murray, and El learns about the circumstances surrounding her birth.

episodes.name: Chapter Six: The Spy
episodes.summary: Owens and his team try to find a way to end the shadow creature's influence on Will. Meanwhile, Dustin and Lucas find unlikely allies in their quest to find Dart.

episodes.name: Chapter Seven: The Lost Sister
episodes.summary: El travels to Chicago to find her sister Eight, aka Kali, who has teamed up with other outcasts to kill the men who tormented her at Hawkins Labs.

episodes.name: Chapter Eight: The Mind Flayer
episodes.summary: When the demo-dogs overrun Hawkins Labs, one of the group saves the others at the cost of their own life. When the others get back to the Byers house, they realize what they're facing and try to get answers from a captive Will.

episodes.name: Chapter Nine: The Gate
episodes.summary: The group splits up to close the gate, evict the Mind Flayer from Will, and drive the demo-dogs away from Hawkins Lab.

movies.name: South Park
movies.summary: South Park is an adult comedy animation show centred around 4 children in the small town of south park. Its humour is often dark involving satirical elements and mocking current real-life events.

episodes.name: Cartman Gets an Anal Probe
episodes.summary: Aliens wreak havoc in the Rockies, first by subjecting Cartman to an anal probe, and then by abducting Kyle's baby brother.

episodes.name: Weight Gain 4000
episodes.summary: Cartman tries to slim down when he learns a TV talk-show host is coming to town to give him an award, but he bulks up instead. Meanwhile, Mr. Garrison hatches a plan to murder the visiting celeb.

episodes.name: Volcano
episodes.summary: A volcanic eruption interrupts the boys' camping trip.

episodes.name: Big Gay Al's Big Gay Boat Ride
episodes.summary: When his pup explores his sexuality, Stan gets so upset that he inadvertently threatens to blow the school's homecoming-game victory.

episodes.name: An Elephant Makes Love to a Pig
episodes.summary: After a botched genetic experiment, Stan's clone is let loose in the town. Voices include Trey Parker and Matt Stone.

episodes.name: Death
episodes.summary: The boys summon the Grim Reaper.

episodes.name: Pinkeye
episodes.summary: A pinkeye epidemic interrupts the boys' plans to win a Halloween-costume contest; and Kenny has a run-in with a Russian space station when it falls to Earth.

episodes.name: Starvin' Marvin
episodes.summary: After the boys contact an agency that helps starving children, Government authorities send Cartman to Ethiopia. Meanwhile, the town holds a drive for canned goods; and turkeys revolt against a genetic engineer.

episodes.name: Mr. Hankey, the Christmas Poo
episodes.summary: Because he's Jewish, Kyle is denied involvement in the Nativity play and excluded from trips to see Santa. Meanwhile, South Park residents try to plan a politically correct celebration; and Mr. Hankey visits Kyle.

episodes.name: Damien
episodes.summary: As Cartman celebrates his birthday, Jesus Christ and Satan duke it out on a pay-per-view TV special. Meanwhile, Satan's son Damien tries to fit in with the crowd after making a violent first impression.

episodes.name: Tom's Rhinoplasty
episodes.summary: Mr. Garrison takes a leave of absence to have a nose job and is replaced by Miss Ellen, a substitute who threatens Stan and Wendy's relationship.

episodes.name: Mecha-Streisand
episodes.summary: The future of the world is at stake after the boys unearth a prehistoric relic that spawns a monster.

episodes.name: Cartman's Mom is a Dirty Slut
episodes.summary: When Cartman begins to exhibit odd behavior, a counselor suggests that finding his father may solve his problems.

episodes.name: Terrance & Phillip in "Not Without My Anus"
episodes.summary: An episode featuring Terrance and Phillip, who must save Canada from Saddam Hussein.

episodes.name: Cartman's Mom is Still a Dirty Slut
episodes.summary: Chef and the boys rush to the hospital to check on Mephesto, who's gunned down just as he's set to reveal the identity of Cartman's father. Meanwhile, the townspeople search for the gunman and battle a snowstorm.

episodes.name: Chickenlover
episodes.summary: The boys try to circumvent a delicate surgical procedure set to be performed on Kyle's brother as part of a tradition begun by their Jewish ancestors. Meanwhile, Mr. Mackey is cut from his job after he botches a lecture on drugs.

episodes.name: Ike's Wee Wee
episodes.summary: Chaos ensues on the streets of South Park as the town is overcome by a crime wave that leaves scores of chickens assaulted. And Officer Barbrady's no help...because he's resigned.

episodes.name: Conjoined Fetus Lady
episodes.summary: Kyle's terrified after an injury sustained during a dodgeball game sends him to the nurse---a conjoined twin with an unusual medical condition. Meanwhile, Pip leads the dodgeball team to the world championships in China.

episodes.name: The Mexican Staring Frog of Southern Sri Lanka
episodes.summary: Jimbo and Ned launch a TV hunting show, which goes head-to-head with "Jesus and Pals," the popular cable-access series.

episodes.name: City on the Edge of Forever (a.k.a. Flashbacks)
episodes.summary: The boys put twists on events such as the attempted assassination of a talk-show host and a fight with Death as their bus hangs off a cliff. Meanwhile, Ms. Crabtree finds fame when she goes to look for help.

episodes.name: Summer Sucks
episodes.summary: The mayor devises a plan to make the town's Fourth of July celebration memorable, despite a ban on fireworks; and Mr. Hat vanishes, causing Mr. Garrison to visit a therapist.

episodes.name: Chef's Chocolate Salty Balls
episodes.summary: Hollywood pooh-bahs in town for a film festival try to sign Mr. Hankey to a movie deal after their upscale cuisine disrupts the sewage system and nearly destroys him. Meanwhile, locals are up in arms over the movie-industry event.

episodes.name: Chickenpox
episodes.summary: The town faces an outbreak of chicken pox.

episodes.name: Roger Ebert Should Lay Off the Fatty Foods
episodes.summary: Stan, Kyle and Kenny gravitate toward a new planetarium; and Cartman auditions to be the star of "Les Miserables."

episodes.name: Clubhouses
episodes.summary: The boys each build a clubhouse---and Stan is eager to have Wendy over for a game of "truth or dare." However, his parents' separation interferes with his plans.

episodes.name: Cow Days
episodes.summary: During South Park's annual rodeo, the boys compete in a bull-riding contest. Meanwhile, the cows find religion.

episodes.name: Chef Aid
episodes.summary: Chef invites some of his well-known musician friends to participate in a benefit concert after he loses all of his money in a lawsuit. Meanwhile, the boys join the workforce to help him get out of debt.

episodes.name: Spooky Fish
episodes.summary: Stan fears his pet fish may be involved with a rash of unsolved murders that occur on Halloween. Meanwhile, Cartman starts killing people---with kindness, even going so far as to appreciate Wendy's liberal views.

episodes.name: Merry Christmas Charlie Manson!
episodes.summary: The boys go to Cartman's grandmother's house for a holiday feast that's also attended by Cartman's uncle (an escaped con) and the police.

episodes.name: Gnomes (a.k.a. Underpants Gnomes)
episodes.summary: The boys work on a project with a high-strung kid whose parents' coffee shop faces strong competition from a conglomerate that hopes to set up in South Park.

episodes.name: Prehistoric Ice Man
episodes.summary: The boys unearth a prehistoric man frozen in ice, but the discovery jeopardizes Stan and Kyle's friendship when they argue over what to name him.

episodes.name: Rainforest Schmainforest
episodes.summary: The boys accompany a teacher and her singing-and-dancing group to Central America to raise awareness of the rain forest. Also: Kenny falls for a choir member; and Kyle has trouble mastering the choreography.

episodes.name: Spontaneous Combustion
episodes.summary: Residents start to spontaneously combust, prompting Stan's geologist father to investigate.

episodes.name: The Succubus (a.k.a. Chef's Mama)
episodes.summary: Chef gets a visit from his mother when the boys feel his bride-to-be has taken their place in his heart.

episodes.name: Jakovasaurs
episodes.summary: The boys discover two nearly extinct animals while camping on the banks of Stark's Pond.

episodes.name: Tweek vs. Craig
episodes.summary: The boys take a shop class taught by an eccentric, and urge a schoolyard fight between classmates Tweek and Craig.

episodes.name: Sexual Harassment Panda
episodes.summary: Cartman sues Stan for sexual harassment.

episodes.name: Cat Orgy
episodes.summary: Shelly baby-sits Cartman.

episodes.name: Two Guys Naked in a Hot Tub
episodes.summary: A meteor shower hits town, and Stan's sister Shelly babysits Cartman while Mrs. Cartman goes to a "meteor party."

episodes.name: Jewbilee
episodes.summary: Kyle and Ike go on a camping trip while South Park residents wait for a meteor shower to begin.

episodes.name: Korn's Groovy Pirate Ghost Mystery
episodes.summary: On Halloween, the boys are plagued by fifth graders and the town is overrun by pirate ghosts. Music group Korn assists, and sings "Falling Away from Me."

episodes.name: Chinpokomon
episodes.summary: Adults try to counter when the town's children become obsessed with a fad from Japan, whose government reveals their master plan behind the craze.

episodes.name: Hooked on Monkey Fonics
episodes.summary: Kyle tries to teach his new rival about love; the boys compete against home-schooled kids in the annual spelling bee; and Cartman's mom agrees to teach him at home.

episodes.name: Starvin' Marvin in Space!
episodes.summary: Starvin Marvin returns in a stolen U.S. spaceship, and enlists the boys to help feed his Ethiopian village. The CIA is among their pursuers.

episodes.name: The Red Badge of Gayness (a.k.a. War)
episodes.summary: The town holds its annual reenactment of a Civil War battle, and Cartman suits up for the Confederacy with visions of glory.

episodes.name: Mr. Hankey's Christmas Classics
episodes.summary: Mr. Hankey and South Park citizens celebrate the holidays with musical numbers from his Christmas Classics Album.

episodes.name: Are You There God, It's Me Jesus
episodes.summary: "Are You There, God? It's Me, Jesus" purports to "answer age-old questions about who we are and what we're all about."

episodes.name: Worldwide Recorder Concert (a.k.a. The Brown Noise)
episodes.summary: The boys and their class travel to the first "Worldwide Recorder Concert" in Arkansas, where Mr. Garrison confronts the demons of his childhood while visiting his parents.

episodes.name: The Tooth Fairy's TATS 2000
episodes.summary: Cartman impersonates the Tooth Fairy when he learns there's money to be made from harvesting the teeth of underprivileged kids. However, the leader of a dentists' organization sets out to stop him.

episodes.name: Cartman's Silly Hate Crime 2000
episodes.summary: Cartman is sentenced to juvenile hall and his friends plan to get him out. Meanwhile, he begins to adjust to life on the inside.

episodes.name: Timmy! 2000
episodes.summary: Mr. Mackey excuses Timmy from homework when he mistakenly thinks the boy is suffering from Attention Deficit Disorder; then Cartman and his friends try to develop the same affliction.

episodes.name: Quintuplets 2000
episodes.summary: The South Park media showers attention on a family with quintuplets that moves into the area, and Cartman befriends one of the new residents. Meanwhile, Kenny's mom tries to cash in on the excitement by planning a multiple birth of her own.

episodes.name: Cartman Joins NAMBLA
episodes.summary: Cartman seeks online companionship from older users after deciding that Stan, Kenny and Kyle aren't mature enough.

episodes.name: Cherokee Hair Tampons
episodes.summary: Kyle suffers from a rare kidney disease and Cartman may be the only one who can save him, but at a high price.

episodes.name: Chef Goes Nanners
episodes.summary: Chef protests against the South Park flag and ignites a town debate that even divides the kids. Meanwhile, Wendy becomes attracted to Cartman.

episodes.name: Something You Can Do with Your Finger (a.k.a. Fingerbang)
episodes.summary: Stan, Kyle, Kenny and Cartman form their own band and hold tryouts for a fifth member.

episodes.name: Do the Handicapped Go to Hell? (1)
episodes.summary: The boys, scared by Priest Maxi's threats of eternal damnation, scramble to take part in Holy Communion and their first Confession in order to "save" themselves.

episodes.name: Probably (2)
episodes.summary: Satan can't decide between his new boyfriend and his former beau, Saddam Hussein. Meanwhile, Cartman has discovered his evangelical side and tries to ensure the gang a passage to heaven.

episodes.name: Fourth Grade
episodes.summary: The fearful boys speculate on the identity of their teacher as they begin the fourth grade, leading them to build a time machine to take them back to the safety of third grade.

episodes.name: Trapper Keeper
episodes.summary: Mr. Garrison orders a recount when the race for kindergarten president is too close to call. Meanwhile, a life form from the future appears in the school yard at South Park Elementary.

episodes.name: Helen Keller! The Musical
episodes.summary: The boys work on a Thanksgiving pageant about Helen Keller and decide to use a turkey instead of a dog.

episodes.name: Pip (a.k.a. Great Expectations)
episodes.summary: The boys' British classmate, Pip, stars in this spoof of Dickens' classic "Great Expectations," set in London.

episodes.name: Fat Camp
episodes.summary: Cartman is sent to a camp for obese youngsters by concerned family and friends. Meanwhile, Kenny has his own hit TV show, "Krazy Kenny." Also, Chef talks to the boys about prostitution.

episodes.name: The Wacky Molestation Adventure
episodes.summary: Cartman becomes South Park's mayor when the kids take over the town.

episodes.name: A Very Crappy Christmas
episodes.summary: The boys make a video Christmas card when Mr. Hankey's visit is delayed.

episodes.name: It Hits the Fan
episodes.summary: The boys realize they may have made history of some sort when Cartman utters an expletive.

episodes.name: Cripple Fight
episodes.summary: The boys join the Mountain Scouts with Timmy, who winds up in a fight with Jimmy in a supermarket parking lot.

episodes.name: Super Best Friends
episodes.summary: A magician persuades Kenny, Cartman and Kyle to join his cult, and their journey lands them in Washington, D.C.

episodes.name: Scott Tenorman Must Die
episodes.summary: Radiohead plays a role in Cartman's plan for revenge against an eighth-grader who wronged him.

episodes.name: Terrance and Phillip: Behind the Blow
episodes.summary: The boys are devastated to learn that their heroes Terrence and Phillip have broken up.

episodes.name: Cartmanland
episodes.summary: Cartman uses his $1 million inheritance to open his own amusement park.

episodes.name: Proper Condom Use
episodes.summary: The impulsive implementation of sex-education classes at school leads to an all-out battle between the boys and the girls.

episodes.name: Towelie
episodes.summary: The gang tries to protect a new resident in South Park from the government.

episodes.name: Osama Bin Laden Has Farty Pants
episodes.summary: The boys decide to get into the patriotic spirit by heeding the President's advice to send money to the children of Afghanistan. But their spirits sour when they receive a package back and their mail becomes the focus of Government investigators.

episodes.name: How to Eat with Your Butt
episodes.summary: As a prank, Cartman somehow gets Kenny's picture pasted on milk cartons as a missing child, which soon backfires on him.

episodes.name: The Entity (a.k.a. The Ginger Device)
episodes.summary: Kyle is embarrassed by his cousin, Kyle, and tries to think of ways to avoid him in front of his friends.

episodes.name: Here Comes the Neighborhood
episodes.summary: Kyle, Stan, Kenny and Cartman have a run-in with Token, the town's only rich kid. In retaliation, Token encourages other wealthy people to move into the neighborhood.

episodes.name: Kenny Dies
episodes.summary: Cartman discovers the benefits of stem-cell research.

episodes.name: Butters' Very Own Episode
episodes.summary: Butters looks forward to his parents' anniversary dinner despite his mother's reaction to his father's secret extracurricular activities.

episodes.name: Jared Has Aides
episodes.summary: The gang seizes upon an opportunity to make money with a weight-loss program that's sweeping the country.

episodes.name: Asspen
episodes.summary: The boys head to Aspen, where the slopes are superb and Stan gets into a showdown with the lodge's expert skier.

episodes.name: Freak Strike
episodes.summary: The gang decides to put Butters up as a guest on a talk show thinking that they will get special favors.

episodes.name: Fun with Veal
episodes.summary: After learning how veal is made, the boys try to save some calves from the slaughterhouse.

episodes.name: The New Terrance and Phillip Movie Trailer
episodes.summary: The boys look forward to the newest Terrance and Phillip movie.

episodes.name: Professor Chaos
episodes.summary: When Butters is rejected by the kids, his alter ego Professor Chaos is unleashed.

episodes.name: The Simpsons Already Did It
episodes.summary: Cartman and the gang fear that they may have accidentally caused a death.

episodes.name: Red Hot Catholic Love
episodes.summary: A priest visits South Park to find out why church attendance is down; the boys protest the tinkering of their favorite movies.

episodes.name: Free Hat
episodes.summary: The boys try to prevent filmmakers from remaking their movies, but their efforts are mistaken for a campaign for the release of an infamous criminal.

episodes.name: Bebe's Boobs Destroy Society
episodes.summary: When Bebe starts to mature physically, the boys behave so boorishly that their friendships are almost ruined.

episodes.name: Child Abduction is Not Funny
episodes.summary: Media stories about kidnappings drive South Park parents to extreme measures, such as building a wall around the town to keep out predators.

episodes.name: A Ladder to Heaven
episodes.summary: Trying to find Kenny in Heaven, the boys discover that Saddam Hussein may have hidden weapons there.

episodes.name: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
episodes.summary: While returning "The Lord of the Rings" to the video store, the boys accidentally get a hold of a steamy porno tape.

episodes.name: Death Camp of Tolerance
episodes.summary: The boys are sent to a camp where cultural sensitivity is taught.

episodes.name: The Biggest Douche in the Universe
episodes.summary: Cartman takes desperate measures to try to rid himself of Kenny's spirit, including traveling to Scotland.

episodes.name: My Future Self 'n' Me
episodes.summary: Stan is forced to look at his life 30 years in the future; Cartman tries to launch a new business.

episodes.name: Red Sleigh Down
episodes.summary: Cartman tries to score some points with Santa Claus by asking him to deliver presents to the needy children in Iraq.

episodes.name: Cancelled
episodes.summary: The boys are abducted by aliens, who inform them that Earth is actually a reality show that is about to be canceled by intergalactic media moguls.

episodes.name: Krazy Kripples
episodes.summary: The kids become embroiled in the life of a disabled celebrity who breezes through town and gets all the attention.

episodes.name: Toilet Paper
episodes.summary: The boys are under investigation for covering their teacher's house with toilet paper.

episodes.name: I'm a Little Bit Country
episodes.summary: The foul-mouthed youngsters return for a seventh season.

episodes.name: Fat Butt and Pancake Head
episodes.summary: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck come to town.

episodes.name: Lil' Crime Stoppers
episodes.summary: The guys start their own detective agency.

episodes.name: Red Man's Greed
episodes.summary: The boys try to save the town from developers.

episodes.name: South Park is Gay!
episodes.summary: The whole town suddenly discovers it's all the rage to be gay.

episodes.name: Christian Rock Hard
episodes.summary: Cartman puts together a band; Stan, Kyle and Kenny get into trouble for downloading music from the Internet.

episodes.name: Grey Dawn
episodes.summary: The boys try to have South Park's senior citizens stripped of their driver's licenses after they go on a dangerous rampage.

episodes.name: Casa Bonita
episodes.summary: Cartman seeks revenge for not being invited to Kyle's birthday outing.

episodes.name: All About the Mormons?
episodes.summary: Mormon neighbors move into town, causing the citizens of South Park to become Mormons themselves.

episodes.name: Butt Out
episodes.summary: The guys rebel after an anti-smoking campaign begins at their school.

episodes.name: Raisins
episodes.summary: When Stan's girlfriend breaks up with him, his friends try to cheer him up by bringing him to a local restaurant where lovely ladies hang out.

episodes.name: It's Christmas in Canada
episodes.summary: Ike's Canadian birth parents come back to claim him, prompting the residents of South Park to collect money to get him back.

episodes.name: Good Times with Weapons
episodes.summary: After buying some martial arts objects at a market, the boys turn into Japanese warriors to take on their enemy, Prof. Chaos.

episodes.name: Up the Down Steroid
episodes.summary: Steroids become an issue as Timmy, Jimmy and Cartman train for a sporting event.

episodes.name: The Passion of the Jew
episodes.summary: "The Passion of the Christ" has an unusual effect on Stan, Cartman, Kyle and Kenny.

episodes.name: You Got F**ked in the Ass
episodes.summary: Stan tries to put together a group of competitive dancers to challenge some rivals from Orange County.

episodes.name: AWESOM-O
episodes.summary: Cartman disguises himself as a robot so he can learn secrets about Butters to use against him.

episodes.name: The Jeffersons
episodes.summary: A mysterious gentleman and his son create controversy in South Park.

episodes.name: Goobacks
episodes.summary: South Park becomes flooded with time travelers from the future.

episodes.name: Douche and Turd
episodes.summary: The kids have to choose a new mascot after an animal-rights group protests.

episodes.name: Something Wall-Mart This Way Comes
episodes.summary: South Park is invaded by a giant shopping center that threatens the quiet little town.

episodes.name: Pre-School
episodes.summary: Cartman, Butters, Kenny, Stan and Kyle fear that a secret may get out when an old adversary turns up in town.

episodes.name: Quest for Ratings
episodes.summary: Cartman becomes a network honcho when he and the boys launch a morning news show on the school's closed-circuit TV station.

episodes.name: Stupid Spoiled Whore Video Playset
episodes.summary: South Park is abuzz over a visit from a famous socialite.

episodes.name: Cartman's Incredible Gift
episodes.summary: Cartman is imbued with the power to see into the future after he's hit on the head.

episodes.name: Woodland Critter Christmas
episodes.summary: Woodland creatures ask Stan to help them build a manger.

episodes.name: Mr. Garrison's Fancy New Vagina
episodes.summary: In the season 9 premiere, Mr. Garrison looks to become a woman, and Kyle works in improving his basketball skills.

episodes.name: Die Hippie, Die
episodes.summary: Hippies, the bane of Cartman's existence, threaten to overrun South Park when they plan a weeklong music festival in town.

episodes.name: Wing
episodes.summary: Cartman, Kenny, Stan and Kyle become talent agents with one client.

episodes.name: Best Friends Forever
episodes.summary: Kenny is able to purchase a gaming device that's been sold out, straining his friendship with Cartman.

episodes.name: The Losing Edge
episodes.summary: The boys become bored with baseball after a long winning streak.

episodes.name: The Death of Eric Cartman
episodes.summary: Butters believes he can talk to the dead.

episodes.name: Erection Day
episodes.summary: Jimmy has trouble controlling his hormones right before the big talent show.

episodes.name: Two Days Before the Day After Tomorrow
episodes.summary: The town of Beaverton is flooded when a mammoth beaver dam breaks. Is global warming to blame? Only Stan and Cartman know for sure.

episodes.name: Marjorine
episodes.summary: The boys decide to fake Butters' death and resurrect him as a girl.

episodes.name: Follow That Egg
episodes.summary: Townsfolk rally against gay marriage, especially Mr. Garrison, whose ex Mr. Slave plans to wed Big Gay Al.

episodes.name: Ginger Kids
episodes.summary: Ostracized for his appearance because of a case of "gingervitus," Cartman goes on a campaign against discrimination.

episodes.name: Trapped in the Closet
episodes.summary: Religious leaders think Stan is the "Golden Child," prompting believers to camp in front of his house.

episodes.name: Free Willzyx
episodes.summary: Kyle bonds with a marine-park whale and gets the boys to help try to return the creature to its family.

episodes.name: Bloody Mary
episodes.summary: After his drunken-driving arrest, Stan's dad believes a visit to a bleeding statue of the Virgin Mary will cure his drinking problem.

episodes.name: The Return of Chef
episodes.summary: Chef Jerome McElroy returns, though the kids notice he's not quite the same.

episodes.name: Smug Alert!
episodes.summary: Stan leads a campaign to purchase hybrid cars, but it stalls when an environmental disaster threatens the town.

episodes.name: Cartoon Wars (1)
episodes.summary: Kyle and Cartman race to Hollywood, with the fate of Kyle's favorite cartoon, "Family Guy," at stake.

episodes.name: Cartoon Wars (2)
episodes.summary: Kyle is injured and Cartman must forge on alone, determined to stop the makers of "Family Guy."

episodes.name: A Million Little Fibers
episodes.summary: Oprah picks Towelie's memoir for her book club, but his account is found to be less than truthful. Soon, the public derision lures Towelie off the wagon.

episodes.name: ManBearPig
episodes.summary: Cartman finds treasure when the boys get stuck in a cave.

episodes.name: Tsst
episodes.summary: Cartman's mom employs the Dog Whisperer to help curb her son's behavioral problems.

episodes.name: Make Love, Not Warcraft
episodes.summary: The gang attempts to save the online game World of Warcraft after it is taken over by a renegade gamer.

episodes.name: Mystery of the Urinal Deuce
episodes.summary: The gang discovers who's responsible for the 9/11 attacks and realizes South Park may be in danger.

episodes.name: Miss Teacher Bangs a Boy
episodes.summary: Cartman is tapped to be the new hallway monitor and takes offense when Kyle discovers a teacher is having an affair with a student in his jurisdiction.

episodes.name: Hell on Earth 2006
episodes.summary: Satan tries to plan a Halloween party while dealing with a religious group, an ex-lover and mischievous serial killers.

episodes.name: Go God Go (1)
episodes.summary: South Park residents clash over the teaching of evolution. Meanwhile, Cartman attempts time travel so he can play a soon-to-be-released video-game system.

episodes.name: Go God Go XII (2)
episodes.summary: Cartman tries to escape a dystopian future plagued by militant otters and a lack of video games.

episodes.name: Stanley's Cup
episodes.summary: Stan Marsh has hit rock bottom. He's got no job, no bicycle and his only way out of a bad situation is to coach the local pee wee hockey team. Once a hotshot pee wee hockey player himself, Marsh has tried to put those days behind him. But he's still living with the memory of how he let his team down when he missed the winning shot in the big game. Now, he's about to find out that being a coach means facing your past. He's determined to show his kids what it's like to be winners!

episodes.name: With Apologies to Jesse Jackson
episodes.summary: Randy Marsh is publicly chastised for using the N-word on national television. Meanwhile, Cartman clashes with a little person.

episodes.name: Cartman Sucks
episodes.summary: Butters is sent to a religious camp that promotes a heterosexual lifestyle.

episodes.name: Lice Capades
episodes.summary: th Park Elementary deals with a head-lice scare, and Cartman looks to expose the kids with infected scalps.

episodes.name: The Snuke
episodes.summary: lary Clinton makes a campaign stop in South Park. Meanwhile, Cartman believes he's uncovered a terrorist plot.

episodes.name: Fantastic Easter Special
episodes.summary: Stan searches for the origins of egg decorating, and falls in with a strange society guarding an infamous secret.

episodes.name: D-Yikes
episodes.summary: Ms. Garrison gets dumped again, so the boys decide to hire someone to remedy the situation.

episodes.name: Night of the Living Homeless
episodes.summary: The homeless population is on the rise in South Park. Both the adults and children go to work looking for solutions to the problem.

episodes.name: Le Petit Tourette
episodes.summary: Cartman pretends to have Tourette's syndrome in order to say whatever he wants.

episodes.name: More Crap
episodes.summary: Randy Marsh becomes a local hero after passing a sizable bowel movement. Later, he contacts a record-keeping society to find out if he has surpassed the world record.

episodes.name: Imaginationland (1)
episodes.summary: The boys enter a dimension containing the world's imagination. Before long, the government taps them for intelligence.

episodes.name: Imaginationland (2)
episodes.summary: Pentagon officials pressure Kyle and Stan to reveal how they gained access to Imaginationland. Meanwhile, Cartman searches for Kyle in order to make him fulfill his side of the leprechaun bet.

episodes.name: Imaginationland (3)
episodes.summary: Stan and Butters attempt to escape Imaginationland before the government detonates a nuclear device in the alternate dimension. Meanwhile, Cartman takes his bet with Kyle to the Supreme Court.

episodes.name: Guitar Queer-o
episodes.summary: Stan and Kyle become a successful Guitar Hero duo. After they part ways, Stan succumbs to the pitfalls of rock stardom.

episodes.name: The List
episodes.summary: The boys discover a secret list compiled by their female classmates that rates them according to looks.

episodes.name: Tonsil Trouble
episodes.summary: In the 12th-season premiere, Cartman faces an uncertain future after a routine tonsillectomy reveals a more serious condition.

episodes.name: Britney's New Look
episodes.summary: The boys meet Britney Spears while she's on a search for seclusion in the Colorado mountains, and Stan and Kyle eventually take on the responsibility of getting her to the North Pole.

episodes.name: Major Boobage
episodes.summary: Suspicions by friends and family of Kenny's drug use play out in an homage to the 1981 animated fantasy "Heavy Metal."

episodes.name: Canada on Strike
episodes.summary: When Canada goes on strike, the boys find themselves in the thick of negotiations for a settlement, and the void in U.S. jobs is filled by replacements from Denmark. Meanwhile, Terrance and Phillip are on the fence about joining the strike, but are shocked by its fiscal consequences.

episodes.name: Eek, a Penis!
episodes.summary: Cartman takes over Ms. Garrison's class when the teacher's personal crisis causes her to be removed from the classroom.

episodes.name: Over Logging
episodes.summary: When a lack of Internet access in South Park sparks panic in the community, Randy takes his family to California in search of a signal.

episodes.name: Super Fun Time
episodes.summary: A class trip to a living museum that recreates 1800s Colorado leads to a hostage situation for some of the boys.

episodes.name: The China Probrem
episodes.summary: Butters stands with Cartman as he confronts the Chinese after a tragic event.

episodes.name: Breast Cancer Show Ever
episodes.summary: Wendy courts trouble when she vows to beat up Cartman after school.

episodes.name: Pandemic (1)
episodes.summary: Cartman enlists the help of rival Craig when the boys spot an easy opportunity for financial gain from a global crisis.

episodes.name: Pandemic (2): The Startling
episodes.summary: The boys discover the reason for the global attacks by oversize guinea pigs, but first they have to find their way out of the Andes.

episodes.name: About Last Night...
